SAM Simulation Core (SSC)
lsqfit.h
1 /*
2  * MINPACK-1 Least Squares Fitting Library
3  *
4  * Original public domain version by B. Garbow, K. Hillstrom, J. More'
5  * (Argonne National Laboratory, MINPACK project, March 1980)
6  *
7  * Tranlation to C Language by S. Moshier (moshier.net)
8  *
9  * Enhancements and packaging by C. Markwardt
10  * (comparable to IDL fitting routine MPFIT
11  * see http://cow.physics.wisc.edu/~craigm/idl/idl.html)
12  */
13 
14 /* Header file defining constants, data structures and functions of
15  mpfit library
16  $Id: mpfit.h,v 1.14 2010/11/13 08:15:07 craigm Exp $
17 */

20 #define MPFIT_H

24 /* MPFIT version string */
25 #define MPFIT_VERSION "1.2-cpp-apd"
26 
27 /* Definition of a parameter constraint structure */
28 struct mp_par_struct {
29  int fixed; /* 1 = fixed; 0 = free */
30  int limited[2]; /* 1 = low/upper limit; 0 = no limit */
31  double limits[2]; /* lower/upper limit boundary value */
32 
33  char *parname; /* Name of parameter, or 0 for none */
34  double step; /* Step size for finite difference */
35  double relstep; /* Relative step size for finite difference */
36  int side; /* Sidedness of finite difference derivative
37  0 - one-sided derivative computed automatically
38  1 - one-sided derivative (f(x+h) - f(x) )/h
39  -1 - one-sided derivative (f(x) - f(x-h))/h
40  2 - two-sided derivative (f(x+h) - f(x-h))/(2*h)
41  3 - user-computed analytical derivatives
42  */
43  int deriv_debug; /* Derivative debug mode: 1 = Yes; 0 = No;
44 
45  If yes, compute both analytical and numerical
46  derivatives and print them to the console for
47  comparison.
48 
49  NOTE: when debugging, do *not* set side = 3,
50  but rather to the kind of numerical derivative
51  you want to compare the user-analytical one to
52  (0, 1, -1, or 2).
53  */
54  double deriv_reltol; /* Relative tolerance for derivative debug
55  printout */
56  double deriv_abstol; /* Absolute tolerance for derivative debug
57  printout */
58 };
59 
60 /* Just a placeholder - do not use!! */
61 typedef void (*mp_iterproc)(void);
62 
63 /* Definition of MPFIT configuration structure */
64 struct mp_config_struct {
65  /* NOTE: the user may set the value explicitly; OR, if the passed
66  value is zero, then the "Default" value will be substituted by
67  mpfit(). */
68  double ftol; /* Relative chi-square convergence criterium Default: 1e-10 */
69  double xtol; /* Relative parameter convergence criterium Default: 1e-10 */
70  double gtol; /* Orthogonality convergence criterium Default: 1e-10 */
71  double epsfcn; /* Finite derivative step size Default: MP_MACHEP0 */
72  double stepfactor; /* Initial step bound Default: 100.0 */
73  double covtol; /* Range tolerance for covariance calculation Default: 1e-14 */
74  int maxiter; /* Maximum number of iterations. If maxiter == 0,
75  then basic error checking is done, and parameter
76  errors/covariances are estimated based on input
77  parameter values, but no fitting iterations are done.
78  Default: 200
79  */
80  int maxfev; /* Maximum number of function evaluations, or 0 for no limit
81  Default: 0 (no limit) */
82  int nprint; /* Default: 1 */
83  int douserscale;/* Scale variables by user values?
84  1 = yes, user scale values in diag;
85  0 = no, variables scaled internally (Default) */
86  int nofinitecheck; /* Disable check for infinite quantities from user?
87  0 = do not perform check (Default)
88  1 = perform check
89  */
90  mp_iterproc iterproc; /* Placeholder pointer - must set to 0 */
91 
92 };
93 
94 /* Definition of results structure, for when fit completes */
95 struct mp_result_struct {
96  double bestnorm; /* Final chi^2 */
97  double orignorm; /* Starting value of chi^2 */
98  int niter; /* Number of iterations */
99  int nfev; /* Number of function evaluations */
100  int status; /* Fitting status code */
101 
102  int npar; /* Total number of parameters */
103  int nfree; /* Number of free parameters */
104  int npegged; /* Number of pegged parameters */
105  int nfunc; /* Number of residuals (= num. of data points) */
106 
107  double *resid; /* Final residuals
108  nfunc-vector, or 0 if not desired */
109  double *xerror; /* Final parameter uncertainties (1-sigma)
110  npar-vector, or 0 if not desired */
111  double *covar; /* Final parameter covariance matrix
112  npar x npar array, or 0 if not desired */
113  char version[20]; /* MPFIT version string */
114 };
115 
116 /* Convenience typedefs */
117 typedef struct mp_par_struct mp_par;
118 typedef struct mp_config_struct mp_config;
119 typedef struct mp_result_struct mp_result;
120 
121 /* Enforce type of fitting function */
122 typedef int (*mp_func)(int m, /* Number of functions (elts of fvec) */
123  int n, /* Number of variables (elts of x) */
124  double *x, /* I - Parameters */
125  double *fvec, /* O - function values */
126  double **dvec, /* O - function derivatives (optional)*/
127  void *private_data); /* I/O - function private data*/
128 
129 /* Error codes */
130 #define MP_ERR_INPUT (0) /* General input parameter error */
131 #define MP_ERR_NAN (-16) /* User function produced non-finite values */
132 #define MP_ERR_FUNC (-17) /* No user function was supplied */
133 #define MP_ERR_NPOINTS (-18) /* No user data points were supplied */
134 #define MP_ERR_NFREE (-19) /* No free parameters */
135 #define MP_ERR_MEMORY (-20) /* Memory allocation error */
136 #define MP_ERR_INITBOUNDS (-21) /* Initial values inconsistent w constraints*/
137 #define MP_ERR_BOUNDS (-22) /* Initial constraints inconsistent */
138 #define MP_ERR_PARAM (-23) /* General input parameter error */
139 #define MP_ERR_DOF (-24) /* Not enough degrees of freedom */
140 
141 /* Potential success status codes */
142 #define MP_OK_CHI (1) /* Convergence in chi-square value */
143 #define MP_OK_PAR (2) /* Convergence in parameter value */
144 #define MP_OK_BOTH (3) /* Both MP_OK_PAR and MP_OK_CHI hold */
145 #define MP_OK_DIR (4) /* Convergence in orthogonality */
146 #define MP_MAXITER (5) /* Maximum number of iterations reached */
147 #define MP_FTOL (6) /* ftol is too small; no further improvement*/
148 #define MP_XTOL (7) /* xtol is too small; no further improvement*/
149 #define MP_GTOL (8) /* gtol is too small; no further improvement*/
150 
151 /* Double precision numeric constants */
152 #define MP_MACHEP0 2.2204460e-16
153 #define MP_DWARF 2.2250739e-308
154 #define MP_GIANT 1.7976931e+308
155 
156 #if 0
157 /* Float precision */
158 #define MP_MACHEP0 1.19209e-07
159 #define MP_DWARF 1.17549e-38
160 #define MP_GIANT 3.40282e+38
161 #endif
162 
163 #define MP_RDWARF (sqrt(MP_DWARF*1.5)*10)
164 #define MP_RGIANT (sqrt(MP_GIANT)*0.1)
165 
166 
167 /* External function prototype declarations */
168 extern int mpfit(mp_func funct, int m, int npar,
169  double *xall, mp_par *pars, mp_config *config,
170  void *private_data,
171  mp_result *result);
172 
173 
174 /*
175  simplified API for basic fitting
176  added 12/12/14 by a.dobos
177 
178  returns integer 'info':
179  * info = 0 improper input parameters.
180 *
181 * info = 1 both actual and predicted relative reductions
182 * in the sum of squares are at most ftol.
183 *
184 * info = 2 relative error between two consecutive iterates
185 * is at most xtol.
186 *
187 * info = 3 conditions for info = 1 and info = 2 both hold.
188 *
189 * info = 4 the cosine of the angle between fvec and any
190 * column of the jacobian is at most gtol in
191 * absolute value.
192 *
193 * info = 5 number of calls to fcn has reached or
194 * exceeded maxfev.
195 *
196 * info = 6 ftol is too small. no further reduction in
197 * the sum of squares is possible.
198 *
199 * info = 7 xtol is too small. no further improvement in
200 * the approximate solution x is possible.
201 *
202 * info = 8 gtol is too small. fvec is orthogonal to the
203 * columns of the jacobian to machine precision.
204 
205  example:
206 
207  double Io_fit( double _x, double *par, void *user_data )
208  {
209  double T = _x;
210 
211  const double Tref = 298.15;
212  double dT = (T+273.15)-Tref;
213  double Egref = par[0];
214 
215  double Eg = (1-0.0002677*T)*Egref;
216  return pow((Tref+dT)/Tref,3)*exp( 11600 * (Egref/Tref - Eg/(Tref+dT)));
217  }
218 
219  double Egref[1] = { 1.0 }; // initial guess for one parameter nonlinear fit
220  int info = lsqfit( Io_fit, 0, Egref, 1, &temps[0], &Io_avgs[0], temps.size() );
221 */
222 int lsqfit( double (*function)( double _x, double *par, void *user_data ), void *user_data,
223  double par[], size_t npar, double *xdata, double *ydata, size_t len,
224  double tol = 1e-9, // tolerance criterion for convergence
225  int maxit = 200, // max iterations
226  int maxfc = 0 ); // max function calls
227 
228 
229 
230 /* linear least squares fit */
231 int linlsqfit(double *slope, double *intercept, double *xdata, double *ydata, size_t len);
232 
233 
234 /* C99 uses isfinite() instead of finite() */
235 #if defined(__STDC_VERSION__) && __STDC_VERSION__ >= 199901L
236 #define mpfinite(x) isfinite(x)
237 
238 /* Microsoft C uses _finite(x) instead of finite(x) */
239 #elif defined(_MSC_VER) && _MSC_VER
240 #include <float.h>
241 #define mpfinite(x) _finite(x)
242 
243 /* iOS does not include finite() support */
244 #elif defined(_IOS_VER) && _IOS_VER
245 #define mpfinite(x) isfinite(x)
246 
247 /* Default is to assume that compiler/library has finite() function */
248 #else
249 #define mpfinite(x) finite(x)
250 
251 #endif
252 
253 
254 
255 #endif /* MPFIT_H */
